this_title: Who Flew First: Challenging The Wright Brothers
trans_title: First Flight: Conquest of the Skies
La conquête du ciel, l'énigme du premier vol motorisé
Pioniere am Himmel – Das Rätsel um den ersten Flug
introduction: First Flight is a docu-drama about the controversy over the world’s first motorized flight. Every school child is taught that the brothers Orville and Wilbur Wright flew first in December 1903. But the Australian aviation expert John Brown argues that the German born immigrant to the US, Gustave Whitehead, flew two years before the Wright Brothers, in August 1901, in Bridgeport, Connecticut.Opposing Brown are historians supporting the official view that the Wright Brothers flew first. They claim that the 17 eye-witness accounts from the 1930s attesting to Whitehead’s flights are unreliable. We also discover that in return for the right to display the 1903 flyer in their museum, the Smithsonian Institution agreed that it will never claim that anyone flew before the Wrights.History may not be as certain as we thought.Produced by ARTEMIS FILM in association with Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC), Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen (ZDF), ZDF Enterprises and Arte
chinese_title: Who Flew First: Challenging The Wright Brothers
